title: More on Rippers vs Binders
abstract: Letters and Comments1 March 1971More on Rippers vs BindersVICTOR R. NEUFELD, M.D. F.R.C.P.(C), ANNE LEIBL, M.L.S.VICTOR R. NEUFELD, M.D. F.R.C.P.(C)Search for more papers by this author, ANNE LEIBL, M.L.S.Search for more papers by this authorAuthor, Article, and Disclosure Informationhttps://doi.org/10.7326/0003-4819-74-3-453_2 SectionsAboutPDF ToolsAdd to favoritesDownload CitationsTrack CitationsPermissions ShareFacebookTwitterLinkedInRedditEmail ExcerptTo the editor: As an additional comment on your "Binders vs. Rippers" poll(1), the following may be of interest.We have recently completed a survey (2) of the self-education patterns of interns, residents, and research fellows in 13 Toronto hospitals and compared these with attending staff physicians in a single hospital (Toronto Western Hospital). Included in the data was information on the number of binders and rippers of general and specialty journals.The summary (Table 1) indicates that for specialty journals (of which the ANNALSis one), the ratio of rippers to binders was 2.4 to 1, in comparison with...References1. DEATON J: The Annals: to rip or bind? (Letter). Ann Intern Med 71:212, 1969 LinkGoogle Scholar2. NEUFELDLEIBL VA: Unpublished observations Google Scholar3. Letters: Rip or bind? A ripping response.
